content:
Another episode of our seminar series: the next date of the ItaCa Fest will be on 2023-09-28T14:00:00+01:00

We will be hosting two amazing talks

  1. Steve Awodey, Algebraic Type Theory
  2. Joshua Wrigley, Topological groupoids for classifying toposes

at the following Zoom link:
https://cs-ox-ac-uk.zoom.us/j/97878376376?pwd=QithMyt5NzdOeE1EWGJRcjBxamxnUT09

As always, we welcome a good discussion and you can stick with us for a chat after the last talk.

You can find the abstracts and more on our seminar at the Fest's page:

https://progetto-itaca.github.io/pages/fest23.html#sep28

Hope to see you soon!
what timezone are the times on the webpage in?
(oh, just saw that you used the magic Zulip date command in your message here, so that answers the question that prompted the above one!)

Tim Hosgood said:

what timezone are the times on the webpage in?

that's a sensible question and I'd love the website to say 'Rome' but you'll just have to guess it from the context :) or from your friendly Zulip ambassador

From #general: mailing list mirror:

Dear all,
I am writing to remind you that on October 25th, we have ItaCa Fest. In line with the new format, we will have 3 talks, listed below.

15:00 - 15:40 G. Lobbia, "A skew approach to enrichment for Gray-categories"
15:40 - 16:20 N. Gambino, "Monoidal bicategories, differential linear logic, and analytic functors”
16:20 - 17:00 S. R. Koudenburg, "Formal Day convolution and low-dimensional monoidal fibrations”
You can find the abstracts here: https://progetto-itaca.github.io/pages/fest23.html#oct25.

The link is the usual:

https://cs-ox-ac-uk.zoom.us/j/97878376376?pwd=QithMyt5NzdOeE1EWGJRcjBxamxnUT09

Best,
the ItaCa people.

——————————————
Ivan Di Liberti
Postdoc
Göteborgs universitet
https://diliberti.github.io<https://diliberti.github.io>

ItaCa Fest is back!

Here the calendar of next speakers: https://progetto-itaca.github.io/fests/fest24.html

As advertised on the CT mailing list:
Email Gateway said:

Dear all,

this is a reminder that ItaCa Fest is returning to live streaming on April 10th at 15:00 Italian time. Below are the speakers for the first day:

• Pierre-Alain Jacqmin: Surjection-like Classes of Morphisms
• Manuel Mancini: On the Representability of Actions of Non-associative Algebras
• Alan Cigoli: From Yoneda's Additive Regular Spans to Fibred Cartesian Monoidal Opfibrations

For the abstracts, the Zoom link, and details on upcoming seminars, visit our website: https://progetto-itaca.github.io/fests/fest24.html<https://url.au.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/qOTbCQnM1WfGwDkGsMfALT?domain=progetto-itaca.github.io>.

Best regards,
The Scientific Committee

——————————————
Ivan Di Liberti
Postdoc
Göteborgs universitet
https://diliberti.github.io<https://url.au.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/ls2aCRONg6s93Kv9uOiwiL?domain=diliberti.github.io>

As advertised on the CT mailing list:
Email Gateway said:

Dear all,

this is a reminder that ItaCa Fest is returning to live streaming on May 7th at 15:00 Italian time. Below are the speakers for the first day:

• S. Wolf: Higher Category Theory Internal to an Infinity Topos
• F. Rota: Exceptional collections and pseudolattices in mirror symmetry
• V. Ozornova: Equivalences in higher categories

For the abstracts, the Zoom link, and details on upcoming seminars, visit our website: https://progetto-itaca.github.io/fests/fest24.html<https://url.au.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/xXtrC0YKgRs1zEv6F2E48F?domain=progetto-itaca.github.io>.

Best regards,
The Scientific Committee

——————————————
Ivan Di Liberti
Postdoc
Göteborgs universitet
https://diliberti.github.io<https://url.au.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/z01ECgZ05JfMJg6VT3Bvu0?domain=diliberti.github.io>
Do you know if any of these talks will be recorded?

As advertised on the CT mailing list:

Dear all,

this is to remind you that ItaCa Fest continues on the 5th of June. Below you find the list of talks. Let me remind you that in this special case, we start at 17.00 (Italian Time).

  • Luigi Santocanale, Complete congruences of completely distributive lattices.
  • Jonathan Weinberger, The dependent Gödel fibration.
  • Luca Spada, 2-Weil 2-rigs.

You can also find all the abstract here: https://progetto-itaca.github.io/fests/fest24.html#jun<https://url.au.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/O0hNCL7Eg9fGVpNDTmdNCt?domain=progetto-itaca.github.io>
The zoom link: https://cs-ox-ac-uk.zoom.us/j/97878376376?pwd=QithMyt5NzdOeE1EWGJRcjBxamxnUT09<https://url.au.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/u9u8CMwGj8CwD0xycQc_WI?domain=cs-ox-ac-uk.zoom.us>

(ndr, Italian time is currently UTC+2)

Echoing @Greta Coraglia 's email:

Dear all,

this is to remind you that ItaCa Fest is back from its summer break on the 25th of September. Below you find the list of the talks, this week we start at 2024-09-25T15:00:00+02:00 .

  • Dario Stein, Random variables and categories of abstract sample spaces.
  • Danel Ahman, Comodule representations of second-order functionals.
  • Matthew Di Meglio, Abstraction of contradiction.

You can also find all the abstracts here: https://progetto-itaca.github.io/fests/fest24.html#sep
The zoom link: https://cs-ox-ac-uk.zoom.us/j/97878376376?pwd=QithMyt5NzdOeE1EWGJRcjBxamxnUT09

Hope to see you there!
The scientific committee

Echoing Greta's email:

Dear all,

this is to remind you that ItaCa Fest will be back once again on October 22nd. Below you find the list of the talks, as always we start at 2024-10-22T15:00:00+02:00 .

  • John Bourke, Bicategorical enrichment in algebra.
  • Giacomo Tendas, Regular theories from the enriched point of view.
  • Luca Mesiti, Towards elementary 2-toposes.

You can also find all the abstracts at: https://progetto-itaca.github.io/fests/fest24.html#oct
The zoom link is: https://cs-ox-ac-uk.zoom.us/j/97878376376?pwd=QithMyt5NzdOeE1EWGJRcjBxamxnUT09

Hope to see you there!
The scientific committee

Next installment of ItaCa Fest 2024 is happening on 2024-11-20T15:00:00+01:00 , the speaker and talks will be

  • Nicola Carissimi, Enriched bicategories for enrichies bi(co)ends
  • Giuseppe Leoncini, Enriched Homotopy Cocompletions
  • Ivan Di Liberti, Taking ItaCa seriously

You can also find all the abstracts at: https://progetto-itaca.github.io/fests/fest24.html#nov
The zoom link is: https://cs-ox-ac-uk.zoom.us/j/97878376376?pwd=QithMyt5NzdOeE1EWGJRcjBxamxnUT09
